attributes.action: Debate on the Impartiality and Transparency of Football Governance in the UK
attributes.additional_details: Call for a government review on UK football's integrity, focusing on FA and PGMOL's fairness in Everton's penalty, VAR inconsistencies, PGMOL's unaccountability, FFP charge delays, and refs' potential conflicts from private work in nation-owned clubs.
attributes.background: Request a debate on Everton's penalty, VAR issues, PGMOL accountability, FFP charge delays, and conflicts in refs working for nation-owned clubs.

rejection.details:
Thank you for your petition. We can only accept petitions about things the Government or Parliament are directly responsible for. Rules of the game of football and arrangements for refereeing are for bodies outside of the Government.

The Government has committed to introducing a statutory regulator for football governance, which will have powers in relation to the financial sustainability of football clubs. You can read further information on the Government's website: https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/reforming-club-football-governance-consultation-response/a-sustainable-future-reforming-club-football-governance-consultation-response
